alert.note: Alert for DeWitt (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 25 at 7:45PM CST until January 28 at 6:51AM CST by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... Guadalupe River Near Cuero affecting DeWitt County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Guadalupe River near Cuero. * WHEN...Until Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 29.0 feet, FM 766 (Hell`s Gate Bridge) closed due to water across roadway between Ed Blackwell Lane and Hell`s Gate Bridge. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM CST Thursday the stage was 26.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 19.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:30 PM CST Thursday was 26.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 29.5 feet tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 29.0 feet on 05/19/1992. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (9 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Guadalupe River Cuero 24.0 26.2 Thu 7 pm CST 29.2 23.0 15.7 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Friday afternoon at 145 PM CST.
